ratioCategories.description: Measures the company's ability to meet short-term obligations using the data from Rev156-1.

ratios.name: Current Ratio
ratios.interpretation: At 2.01, the Company maintains a healthy coverage of short-term liabilities, exceeding the standard benchmark of 1.5. This indicates sufficient liquidity to cover debts twice over.

ratios.name: Quick Ratio
ratios.interpretation: The ratio of 0.63 reflects a heavy reliance on inventory ($1.34M) to meet obligations. Excluding inventory, liquid assets cover only 63% of current liabilities, highlighting a dependency on inventory turnover.

ratios.name: Cash Ratio
ratios.interpretation: With only $155k in cash against $978k in liabilities, the cash position is tight. The company utilizes cash efficiently for operations rather than holding excess liquidity.

ratios.name: Working Capital
ratios.interpretation: Positive working capital of nearly $1M confirms the Company's operational solvency, provided inventory remains liquid.

ratioCategories.description: Evaluates the Company's ability to generate earnings relative to revenue and equity.

ratios.name: Gross Profit Margin
ratios.interpretation: Gross margin is slightly compressed compared to the 25% industry target, possibly due to the mix of equipment sales vs. service revenue.

ratios.name: Operating Profit Margin
ratios.interpretation: Operating efficiency is high, retaining 18.5 cents on the dollar after operating expenses, significantly outperforming typical dealer benchmarks.

ratios.name: Net Profit Margin
ratios.interpretation: A robust bottom line result. The 9.32% margin indicates effective control over non-operating expenses and taxes relative to peer averages.

ratios.name: Return on Assets (ROA)
ratios.interpretation: Asset utilization is highly efficient, generating significant return for every dollar of assets deployed. Note: Source 105 calculates this higher using pre-tax income.

ratios.name: Return on Equity (ROE)
ratios.interpretation: Exceptionally high ROE driven by a relatively low equity base ($532k) compared to Net Income ($423k), suggesting high leverage utilization to drive returns.

ratios.name: EBITDA Margin
ratios.interpretation: Strong operational cash generation potential before financing and accounting decisions.

ratioCategories.description: Analyzes the Company's debt levels and ability to service debt.

ratios.name: Debt-to-Equity Ratio
ratios.interpretation: The company is leveraged at 2.7x equity, indicating aggressive financing, largely due to Floorplan financing ($439k) and Payables ($472k).

ratios.name: Debt-to-Assets Ratio
ratios.interpretation: 73% of assets are financed by creditors, which is typical for equipment dealers with floorplan arrangements but presents solvency risks if asset values drop.

ratios.name: Interest Coverage Ratio
ratios.interpretation: Excellent coverage. Operating income covers interest expense nearly 12 times over, indicating minimal risk of default on interest payments.

ratios.name: Equity Multiplier
ratios.interpretation: High multiplier confirms the strategy of using leverage to amplify returns on equity.

ratioCategories.description: Measures how effectively the Company uses its assets and manages liabilities.

ratios.name: Asset Turnover
ratios.interpretation: The company generates $2.30 in sales for every $1 of assets, indicating superior asset utilization compared to the industry standard.

ratios.name: Inventory Turnover
ratios.interpretation: Turnover is slower than the benchmark (approx. 140 days to sell). This suggests potential overstocking or slow-moving machinery/parts inventory.

ratios.name: Days Sales Outstanding
ratios.interpretation: Collection period is excellent at ~37 days, outperforming the benchmark and ensuring faster cash conversion.

ratios.name: Days Payable Outstanding
ratios.interpretation: The company holds cash longer by delaying payments to ~49 days. While efficient for cash flow, it must be balanced against vendor relationships.

ratios.name: Accounts Receivable Turnover
ratios.interpretation: High turnover indicates efficient credit policies and collection procedures.

ratioCategories.description: Assessment of cash generation. Note: Sources for Rev156 contained truncated Cash Flow Statements [Source 103], preventing audited calculation.

ratios.name: Operating Cash Flow Ratio
ratios.interpretation: Data Unavailable: The specific Statement of Cash Flows for Revision 156-3 (Rev156-1) is truncated in the source text [1], preventing accurate calculation.

ratios.name: Free Cash Flow
ratios.interpretation: Data Unavailable: Capex and OCF data are missing from the source text for this specific revision.

ratios.name: Cash Flow to Debt Ratio
ratios.interpretation: Data Unavailable due to truncated source documentation.

overallAnalysis: Based on the 'NLTS-PR FS 12 31 2024 Rev156-1' documentation, National Lift Truck Service of PR, Inc. demonstrates strong profitability and operational efficiency, with a Net Profit Margin of 9.32% and excellent Interest Coverage (11.93x). However, the balance sheet reveals a constrained liquidity position (Quick Ratio 0.63) driven by substantial inventory holdings ($1.34M) and aggressive leverage (Debt-to-Equity 2.70x). While the company effectively leverages this debt to generate high Returns on Equity (79.52%), the reliance on inventory turnover and floorplan financing presents a specific risk profile that requires careful monitoring of inventory aging. Note: Cash flow analysis was limited by the truncated source data for this specific file revision.
